title: Aderia Retro Tumbler with Stand
description: *335ml *made in Japan Cute and chirpy. The perfect ware for special treats. It's this blazing hot afternoon. We are just couching at home, doing nothing and feeling lazy. A scrumptious sundae, perfect remedy. Aderia Retro is a remade series of popular tablewares used since Showa era. Its signature retro vibe emanated from the adorable shapes and patterns brings warmth to any hospitality setting. The revival of the series is done with improvisation in design for modern daily use and enhanced quality through strict manufacturing practices in their own Ishizuka Glass factory. Note: Glassware is generally sensitive towards sudden change in temperature so we do not recommend pouring boiling hot liquid into it directly.

title: Aderia Retro Tumbler with Stem
description: *305ml *made in Japan Classic and nostalgic. A well-beloved piece that turns ordinary meals into festive and celebratory occasions. Sunny side-ups (not one but two), pan-seared tomatoes, buttered toast, freshly squeezed orange juice, dreadful Monday no more. Yes, we celebrate breakfasts. title: Aderia LAVIA Tea Cup & Stainless Steel Saucer
description: *250ml *handmade in Japan A piece of love at first sight. This tea cup is made of heat resistant glass and can endure temperature better. Hold the saucer. Sophisticatedly rigid! Also, stainless steel ware always has a special place in our heart. Right after unboxing, we enjoyed a house made kombucha in it and can only say: "You need to use it to believe it." Good things come to an end. We were informed this gorgeous set is no longer in production. Silver lining is that we have grabbed some for you guys! Now, fancy a cup of tea?

title: Aderia Retro Wide Mug
description: *310ml *made in Japan We all need a mug. The one that we grab without thinking twice. Favourite honey orchid dancong at 3:30pm watching the rain alone. Heirloom tomato soup on the day you feel slightly under the weather. Ethiopian pour-over to go with the bar chor mee dad packed from Block 502. We are so excited when Aderia Retro launched this wide-mouth edition because it solves so many daily problems. Cheers!!! Aderia Retro is a remade series of popular tablewares used since Showa era. Its signature retro vibe emanated from the adorable shapes and patterns brings warmth to any hospitality setting. The revival of the series is done with improvisation in design for modern daily use and enhanced quality through strict manufacturing practices in their own Ishizuka Glass factory.

title: Ethiopia Guji Shakiso Natural
description: *single origin *espresso The day where you just want a sweet and comforting latte. An americano with just enough tang. Perhaps a ginarmous piece of sea salt chocolate cookie on the side. Classic lemon acidity with black tea texture. Things just get a bit juicier with the mandarin skin in between sips.

title: Ethiopia Guji Shakiso Natural
description: *single origin *espresso The day where you just want a sweet and comforting latte. An americano with just enough tang. Perhaps a ginarmous piece of sea salt chocolate cookie on the side. Classic lemon acidity with black tea texture. Things just get a bit juicier with the mandarin skin in between sips.

title: 0168 Hawker Blend
description: *blend *espresso *dark roast Our milestone blend, the one for the community. To celebrate the entering into a new landscape. To cherish the very new hawker identity, almost like a friendship bracelet we have with the wet market. Thanks for having us, TPY Block 127. An espresso blend made up of Ugandan and a touch of Robusta. Hawker scene is a new landscape to us. Both in dynamics and flavour profiles. We reckon this curated blend is an apt representation of harmony between new wave and heritage, just like kopi and coffee. Nice aroma, nutty lingering with hints of caramel, medium bodied. Versatile for french press, moka pot and even socks brewing.

title: 0168 Hawker Blend

title: Deli Dream Blend
description: *blend *espresso *filter *dark roast Coffee and breakfast, a dream on the table. This blend is our take on morning black coffee savoured across diners booth, neighbourhood kopitiam and kissaten’s bar counter. Everyday, easy, yet packs enough punch to get us through, yet another day. We have had and still are having this dream of putting a wholesome sandwich on the table alongside a cup of sweet and comforting black coffee. Deli, grocery, market or even provisions shop, these establishments are the heartbeats of a neighbourhood, a living neighbourhood, so happening and bustling in the morning. That drove us to curate a blend to be appreciated by the PEOPLE yet filled with the bright nuances, the reasons we are drawn to specialty coffee. And so, deli dream was born. In black, it has a comforting body with sweetness of longan and lychee that shines through especially when it cools down. The malics are just beautiful throughout from hot to cold. Proven, it pairs well with both oriental and

title: Studio M' Relief Cup
description: *160ml *made in Japan *beige Do you start your day with daily news? We start ours with a DAILY cup. This is if not the most but one of the ultimately quintessential household items we need to have at home. A quick sip of water before heading out. Two cups of home made lemonade for Mary and Rose who come over for a visit. Looking fun doesn't mean quality compromised in any way. That's why we highly recommend that you grab a few of these for your family! photo © studio m'

title: Studio M' Good ol' Cup
description: *210ml *made in Japan Please welcome the very first cup we curated even before this online store existed. We have served numerous cups of freshly made hot brew in it at some of our pour over pop up sessions. Made of durable porcelain material, this plump and thick mug is meant to last. It's our everyday mug for coffee in the morning. Compact, stackable. It just looks like the most reliable big brother in house! We always imagine having a hearty breakfast like what they serve at an American diner. Flipping through newspaper, we drizzle maple syrup over hot pancakes and bacon while the friendliest service lady pours us an honest cup of black coffee (made on Bunn). We totally enjoy holding it, sipping coffee and just chilling away a Saturday morning like this. Now, we miss our good old friend, Kay. photo © studio m'

title: Aderia Deep Plate with Stem
description: *285ml *made in Japan We guess the recent soar in temperature drives us inclining towards something christmasy like this deep dish? Kakigori, yes. Jelly and parfait, yes. Cucumber sorbet, yes? Then, you need this! Specially curated these two patterns for the all the above occasions. Stay 'cool' everyone! Aderia Retro is a remade series of popular tablewares used since Showa era. Its signature retro vibe emanated from the adorable shapes and patterns brings warmth to any hospitality setting. The revival of the series is done with improvisation in design for modern daily use and enhanced quality through strict manufacturing practices in their own Ishizuka Glass factory. Note: Glassware is generally sensitive towards sudden change in temperature so we do not recommend pouring boiling hot liquid into it directly.

title: Hawker Hustle Blend
description: *blend *dark roast Our milestone blend, the one for the community. To celebrate the entering into a new landscape. To cherish the very new hawker identity, almost like a friendship bracelet we have with the wet market. Thanks for having us, TPY Block 127. An espresso blend made up of Ugandan and a touch of Robusta. Hawker scene is a new landscape to us. Both in dynamics and flavour profiles. We reckon this curated blend is an apt representation of harmony between new wave and heritage, just like kopi and coffee. This is version 2 with a touch of Malaysian liberica. Nice aroma, nutty lingering with hints of caramel, medium bodied yet the tropical fruit notes are forward in both black and white. Versatile for french press, moka pot and even socks brewing.

Nice aroma, nutty lingering with hints of caramel, medium bodied yet the tropical fruit notes are forward in both black and white. Versatile for french press, moka pot and even socks brewing.

title: Ethiopia Arsi Mewa Nansenbo Washed
description: *single origin *filter We cannot get over a straight forward and delicious washed Ethiopian and are so glad 2nd Mile Specialty Coffee came to rescue. This has got to be your daily pantry necessity. Iced lemon black tea, our soft spot. Anything citrusy just got us. Refreshingly floral, orangy, easy and unfussy, very appropriate for afternoon tea spilling session.

title: Ethiopia Arsi Mewa Nansenbo Washed
description: *single origin *filter We cannot get over a straight forward and delicious washed Ethiopian and are so glad 2nd Mile Specialty Coffee came to rescue. title: Ethiopia Seri Biru Chelchele Washed
description: *single origin *filter Everyday coffee at its best. So lively, so comforting. Balanced and burst with layers of fruits. Classic washed like this is gold. Have this first thing in the morning and we won’t need that breakfast juice. Berries, apricot, jasmine, peach. Favourites, all in one cup. If you fancy a fruity tea like this, we can be friends for life, cheers!

title: Aderia Retro Tumbler
description: *275ml *made in Japan Casual and fun. A glass for any kind of use. The toughened top rim takes away the worries of handling glassware in everyday life. Invite some friends over, welcome them with iced tea or soda in these homely retro glasses and light bites. That should do a pretty good opening for an intimate catch-up or unpretentious home-cooked meal that follows. Aderia Retro is a remade series of popular tablewares used since Showa era. Its signature retro vibe emanated from the adorable shapes and patterns brings warmth to any hospitality setting. The revival of the series is done with improvisation in design for modern daily use and enhanced quality through strict manufacturing practices in their own Ishizuka Glass factory. Note: Glassware is generally sensitive towards sudden change in temperature so we do not recommend pouring boiling hot liquid into it directly.

title: Ethiopia Tibe Haro Uraga Slow Dry Natural
description: *single origin *filter Our favourite way to brew it got to be ICED DRIP! Fruit-forward enough so it stays juicy even with the ice cubes in. 365 days of summer here in Singapore, solid reason to stock this at your pantry bar. You are welcome for the good tip! FRUITY REMEDY. An everyday coffee we have the absolute joy of serving with breakfasts. Peach honey toast. Vanilla custard bun, or maybe a berries danish?

title: SOLO 8
description: *print *magazine Magazine and coffee is always our kind of thing. Back in March this year (2022), we finally stepped foot in Barcelona. Life-changing paella, heart-warming baristas, we fell for the Catalonian capital, head to toe. 'Coffee and News' has been in our radar for so long after locking it on 'Monocle'. From the cathedral area, we strolled along the alleys and streets to finally locate this tiny but compact kiosk. A little shy, just browsing randomly and checking out the coffee bar until we were attended by the lady manager. Her sharing with us SOLO 7 was definitely a highlight moment, also one that leads to us sharing a copy with you now. SOLO started as an independent print project revolving speciality coffee culture, lifestyle and design. Stories of baristas, roasters, farmers and designers from different walks of life, all with a unique perspective in coffee. Their approach in tale-telling about the scene is refreshing. We feel a strong urge to bring this back and introduc
